p: Immediately following the infection and recovery from anesthesia, groups of 10 animals were given 0.1 mL IP injections of suspensions of test compounds in corn oil at the indicated dose or corn oil vehicle alone. Treatments were typically continued twice daily for five days, at 12-hour intervals (at 7 am and 7 pm). Animals were observed daily for a total of 30 days, and the day of death of each animal recorded. Plotting of survival vs dose gave the ED 50 (the concentration of active compound that inhibited plaque formation by 50%) values in Table 1; ED 50 is the individual dose that protected half of the animals.
